newsitem.title: GERMANY: Italy's Prodi to visit Kohl on Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Prodi to visit Kohl on Thursday.

text.p: Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi is to visit Bonn on Thursday for informal talks with Chancellor Helmut Kohl, a German government spokesman said on Tuesday.
Spokesman Peter Hausmann said in a statement that Kohl had invited the Italian leader to join him for dinner at his private bungalow in the grounds of the Bonn chancellery.

Another government spokesman, reached by telephone, said the talks would focus on the European Union, progress on Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) and the inter-governmental conference to review the Maastricht Treaty.
German politicians have angered Rome by saying they doubted Italy would be in good enough economic shape to qualify for EMU ahead of the single currency launch planned for January 1999.
For Germany and France, the driving forces behind European economic and monetary union, the problem of how to deal with a country like Italy remains a difficult balancing act.
Issues such as competitive currency devaluation and domestic political support for EMU are among their main concerns.
